results.title: Sweet and lowdown
results.creator_credit: Jean Doumanian, Sweetland Films BV, Sony Pictures Classics and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Set in the 1930s “Sweet and lowdown” is about a jazz musician who achieves a certain level of fame and respect, with his fingerpicking style. Sean Penn plays Emmet Ray, a talented and vain musician who is socially gauche with a crude personality and amoral ways. When Ray is not playing, he is pimping, thieving or shooting rats at the dump for fun. Ray suffers from an inferiority complex to the famous jazz guitarist Django Reinhardt with whom he constantly compares himself. Despite considering that settling down is detrimental to his artistic drive, Ray forms a deep emotional attachment to a mute girl named Hattie (Samantha Morton) who is enchanted by his music. “Sweet and lowdown” retains a light comical edge throughout and should prove delightful to fans of jazz guitar. As a part of its mockumentary style, several contemporary interviews with jazz experts, including Woody Allen, give insight into Ray’s talent, collectively pondering his mysterious demise. Also stars: Anthony LaPaglia, Uma Thurman and Gretchen Mol.

results.title: Swedish peasant paintings
results.brief_description: A study of the “gourd” paintings done by the itinerant peasant artists who flourished in the Dalecarlia district of Sweden in the eighteenth century. The scenes usually have a religious content, although floral motifs are frequently used. The diea of the gourd as the symbol of life is taken from the Book of Jonah and recurs throughout these domestic paintings.

results.title: Swedish cinema classics
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Swedish Institute and Gardar Sahlberg
results.brief_description: The great period of Swedish silent cinema - the epoch of Victor Sjostrom and Mauritz Stiller - is remembered in a series of commented sequences from their original works.

results.title: Sweden is horrible
results.creator_credit: Wedel Films, Radio Sweden and Karsten Wedel
results.brief_description: Swedish “sin” is better known throughout the world than Swedish steel, to judge by the interest shown by many foreign publications. This film will either help to confirm preconceived notions on this subject or, perhaps, give you ideas about greater sexual equality.

results.title: Sweat of the sun, tears of the moon
results.creator_credit: Clive Fleury, Geoffrey Barnes and ABC
results.brief_description: In 1984, writer and presenter, Jack Pizzey, visited eight South American countries to assess the current political and social climate and the extent of the legacy left by Spanish and Portuguese invaders who came in search of gold (Sweat of the sun), silver (tears of the moon) and Indian souls.

results.title: Swann in Love = Un Amour de Swann
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Bioskop Film, Les Films du Losange, Margaret Menegoz, Eberhard Junkersdorf, Nicole Stephane and Volker Schlondorff
results.brief_description: Based on one of Marcel Proust’s stories from “Remembrance of things past”, the film tells the story of Charles Swann’s obsessively jealous passion for the socially unsuitable Odette de Crecy. Stars Jeremy Irons, Alain Delon and Ornella Muti.

results.title: Swan song = Jue xiang
results.creator_credit: Pearl River Film Studio and Zhang Zeming
results.brief_description: A simple, moving, and allegorical story of an ageing composer of traditional Cantonese music. His harried later years are a reflection of the political vicissitudes of New China. Mandarin and Cantonese dialogue with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pearl River Film Studio and Zhang Zeming

results.title: Swan Lake
results.creator_credit: Francis Coleman, Ceidrik Heward and John Phillips
results.brief_description: Tchaikovsky wrote “Swan Lake” as a commission from the Bolshoi Ballet Theatre in 1875. The full ballet was not produced however, until 1895, after the composer’s death. It captivated audiences then, as it has done ever since, becoming the best loved ballet. This production by the Royal Ballet is descended almost directly from the original St. Petersburg production, with the addition of choreography by Ninette de Valois, Rudolf Nureyev and Sir Frederick Ashton. Performed by Natalia Makarova and Anthony Dowell in the leading roles at The Royal Opera House Covent Garden. There is a brief introduction to the history of the ballet.

results.title: Swan Lake
results.brief_description: A production of Peter Tchaikovsky’s much-loved ballet, featuring Rudolph Nureyev and Margot Fonteyn at the height of their partnership with the Royal Ballet in London. This fairy-tale, which began in Tchaikovsky’s imagination as a piece of fun for his nephews and nieces, is really the first thoroughly considered dance music drama, with a much more symphonic score than his other ballets. Over the years the ballet was savaged by cuts and substitutions, but with Nureyev’s choreography and Nicholas Georgiadis’s sets and costumes the underlying dramatic unity has been restored. The Wiener Symphoniker plays under the direction of John Lanchbury.
